reviewText: Bought this anime simply cause I wanted something to watch and didn't want to rent from Netflix. Read a review from Otaku USA and although the review wasn't all that great I simply liked the character design too much to care and because of the action. Turned out to be a pretty good buy as far as I'm concerned. Storyline is better than I thought and the action is where it's at. Overall, pretty interesting story and very good animation. If you like action and animation and not so much with the story this will probably do it for you.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This series is actually a sequel (spinoff really) to the "428: F'sa Sareta Shibuya de" visual novel for Wii.  The viewer follows friends Canaan and Maria for most of the series.  The series is reminiscent of a Resident Evil style plot where some entity has purposefully infected people with a rare virus.  The virus is almost always lethal, but there are those rare people who actually survive the virus but have their bodies affected in strange ways.  Canaan is one of the people.  Maria is her photographer friend.  Though it is unnecessary to know what happens in the previous visual novel, it does help to explain some of the early plot holes and explain how Maria and Canaan know each other.  Some of this is revealed in flashbacks through the anime series.The series is short, only 13 episodes, but most of the episodes have a lot going on. The animation is very high quality and the backgrounds are lusciously beautiful.  The Japanese voice acting is stellar.  I watched both versions, and I have to say that Yum Yum and Maria in particular are nearly perfectly matched with their Japanese voice actors.My negative points are few, but they are important.  First, due to the short length of the series, there are quite a few plot holes and plot threads left unfinished.  But probably the most annoying is a little 'glitch' in episode 8.  The subtitles actually hit one off.  Basically when someone is speaking, the subtitle for the next persons' audio is shown.  So you see Canaan ask one of the girls if she is okay "Daijoubu ka?" but the subtitle says "Honored Alphard".  Then we see the next scene Cumming's says "Alphard sama" with the subtitle for the next dialogue... awkward!  But this is only in episode 8.  Kind of makes you wonder if Sentai actually watched the finished Japanese audio and English subtitle version for error proofing.The only other negative point is the finale kind of seems rushed and then we see one particular character having a very drawn out and melodramatic breakdown.  I understand it is in keeping with her character, but I might not be the only person who was thinking "Hurry up and die already! I'm sick of hearing you! Jeez!"  But I can totally forgive these small annoyances.I actually checked this out from my local library, so I am quite pleased with it overall; but had I paid $42 I would probably be a bit miffed.  Though it is a good series, it is short, and it's not too necessary to own.  If you can stream this online or rent from Netflix or your local library (if you're lucky enough to have an anime friendly library nearby), then I would recommend that course of action before spending $42 to buy it.
summary: A short yet entertaining anime series~
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Cody Shay "Big Yami No Matsuei Fan.."
reviewText: Canaan isn't exactly the deepest anime series, but what it does it does well.  The show is action packed and exceptionally well animated.  The plot line moves quickly and keeps you interested.  The dub that Sentai gave is one of the best of the year.  Jessica Boone, Shelley Calene Black and Hilary Haag are all cast exceptionally well and do superb jobs.  Jessica Boone's performance towards the end of the series is particularly excellent and one of the best female performances of 2010.The Bluray is also quite good.  It should be noted that like virtually ALL anime releases, Cannaan was not a progressive scan show and was originally broadcast in 720i.  As a result, the Bluray is in 1080i (similar to Torchwood and many other TV shows), as converting a bluray to 1080p often causes numerous artifacts in the video (particularly in computer produced digital animation.)  Sentai and the Japanese producers left the show as close to it's original content as possible.  If you have an older or cheaper setup that does not automatically de-interlace, you may notice some issues there.  But if you have even a basic HDTV, this shouldn't be an issue.  So basically, ignore the reviewer below.  All anime releases are upscales, as Japanese TV is not broadcast in 1080p.Otherwise the video quality is exceptional and it's easily one of the best looking anime bluray releases so far.  The audio quality is also great and made even better with a proper HD audio surround system.If you have the option, go with the bluray.  The video and sound blow the DVD release out of the water.
summary: Excellent Video and Sound Quality for an Excellent Series
Title: N/A

reviewText: Maria was infected by the UA virus. Her father was able to create a vaccine and save her. Most are not so lucky. Those infected either die or develop synethesia; a condition that gives a person superhuman abilities. Canaan is one such girl. When Maria and her partner are researching a story  in Shanghai for the paper they work for, they encounter Canaan. The 3 are drawn together into a plot that could cost many lives. Along with their cheerful and goofy  friend Yun Yun, the team tries to stop the sinister "Snake" organization from spreading the UA virus. The past comes back to haunt them, and the future doesn't look bright; but Canaan shines brightly.This anime has a killer opening and a killer ending. The middle part is up and down. Sometimes it drags, but then it will ick back up again. The plot is very well written. There are also lots of great characters on both sides. Cannan is kind of like a mix between Noir, Burst Angel, and The Third; if you can sort of picture that. It's really good. Tons of action, drama, and comedy. It's not for the young ones though. There is harsh language and almost a bit of nudity. To be honest with you, this was a 3 or 4 star series for me until the last episode or 2. It has a killer ending. I think that most mature anime fans will find this series pretty entertaining.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When this anime first appeared I just assumed it would be yet another "girls with guns" anime like Noir or Madlax, where the two main characters are allies and fight against someone from their past. However, in this series, the two girls on the cover are actually enemies, and the main character, Canaan, wants to seek revenge on the other girl, Alphard, for killing their master. This anime also takes place in China, rather Japan, which is a welcome change from all the Japan-centric series out there.During the series, Canaan reunites with her friend, Maria, who is a photographer, and she wants to catalogue Canaan for an article. Maria and Canaan's relationship seems really close, almost too close at times, but never in an inappropriate way. Maria is also accompanied by a veteran photographer, who is mostly on the journey for comedic moments and some exposition. He meets a green haired girl, named Hakko, who works for a cat café. She appears to be mute, but she has an overprotective boyfriend, who may know more about the conspiracy that surrounds the show.The main villain is Alphard, who heads a terrorist organization known as Snake. She and her group attack an anti-terrorism committee, which the US president attends, and holds everyone hostage with a biological weapon called the Ua Virus. This virus will cause people to hemorrhage until they die.However, Canaan tries to stop Alphard. Canaan has what is called synesthesia, which blends her senses. She views people's emotions as colors, which helps her identify hostiles from civilians. This gives her an edge, and allows her to become a much more skilled mercenary. A lot of anime seem to have a character who is too powerful for their own good for no real reason, but this series explains the reason why Canaan is more powerful than most other characters in the show.One character of particular note is the girl known as Liang Qi. She is utterly devoted to Alphard to the point of obsession, and calls her sister all the time. She becomes so driven with love for her sister that she loses her sanity more and more as the series continues. She acts normal at times, but then turns around and points a gun at people and beats them senselessly.This release is licensed from Sentai Filmworks, and is a very good release. Canaan is from the studio, PA Works, who also worked on Angel Beats and Another, which were also licensed by Sentai, and all three are excellent series. Canaan is a rather short series at 13 episodes, but having a short length does guarantee that each episode will deliver. The last two episodes are probably worth the admission for this anime alone. Overall, this is a really good anime and probably the best girls with guns anime on the market.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm sure you'll say " this show isn't about Yuri" and, hey, you know what, you might be right. Problem is the way the two lead characters interact leads one to think otherwise. I have no problem with two lead females having a strong friendship, in fact I think that makes for good interaction, but when you have two girls holding hands, starring into each others eyes under a stary sky, I just sort of tune off, roll my eyes and say ... really...That's where the plot goes awry. You can't quite tell if its trying to be dark and moody or silly and sweet. Characters aren't the best. Canaan is completely void of anything interesting. Just a vacant sack of. . . Hey there! Lol I jest, no I think baller assasins void of emotion can be cool, I mean Hey from darker than black is on of my favorite characters of all time. Thing is unlike Canaan, he also plays roles of happy tourist, silly collage student, happy lover, and of course remorsless killer. Canaan is just, well, bland. Maria is suppose to be the happy, silly clutz. And she is, completely, dead weight annoying and useless. Alphard is quit interesting though, I found myself rooting for her and twards the end found the only parts I actually enjoyed revolved around her.The plot is pretty weak, something about a virus, but the series seems to forget about it and gear the show more towards Canaan and Maria's relationship instead. It goes something like this. Maria is taken hostage and is saved by the invinsible Canaan, than maria is taken hostage and is saved just in time by. . . . Well that happens about five or so times by episode ten.The animation however is topnotch. I really didn't like the main characters, but I can enjoy the effort and hard work it took to animate something so detailed and fluid. The frame rate is quit impressive and the coloring is rich and vibrant. If your use to naruto or bleach. Or worse yet one piece, this will blow you away. No I am not comparing it to said series. The back ground are also very well painted, with a touch of cg lighting effects.Bottom line is this series is a entertaining action run that has plotting holes and not the greatest led cast, fantastic animation and a relationship that gets nosiatingly close to Yuri.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The other reviews have covered what the story is about...this review is of the actual Blu-Ray release.Unlike what is printed on the back of the case it is not 1080P, it is 1080i. Even so the visuals are excellent if not really sharp. Vibrant colors with no color banding I could detect. Nice fluid motion as well with lines well defined. The DTS-HD Master Audio track is Excellent as well (I watched in Japanese w/ English subtitles). Tried the English track and it's an excellent track as well, just couldn't take Yun Yun's dub voice. Either one has great use of surround sound and the audio is clear enough to hear the "t"s stressed in the opening.There are 4 extras on disc 2: Minorikawa's Report, Clean Opening, Clean Closing, and Credits. Minorikawa's Report basicially just uses video clips from the show to explain what you already know if you have seen the show...AMV's on YouTube are better done than this. The Clean Opening and Closing are nice visually, but the audio is not in HD and has over a 10dB level drop over the DTS-HD Master Audio track along with less definition. The credited episode DTS-HD Master Audio opening is MUCH better in the audio department.So to sum it up - the visuals and audio is excellent in the Episodes. The Extras are good visually, but not so good on the audio end. Definitely would recommend getting the Blu-Ray over the DVD, not only because of the quality, but the Blu-Ray version costs less as well. The price I see now is a little high compared to my pre-ordered price though...$10 higher to be exact.If you are a fan of this type of anime (action/drama/suspension) and don't mind that it's really a Mature title ( I don't see how Canaan retains a TV14 rating...), Canaan is an excellent Blu-Ray release to get.
summary: Canaan Blu-Ray is very a very good release...

reviewText: For fans of femme fatales series like Noir or Madlax  and the like here's another good choice to add to your anime collection, while I truly wish I could have gotten it here but the only version Amazon was selling was the blu-ray version and while good I mostly watch my anime on my PC most time which doesn't have a blu-ray player on it yet so I bought the regular set on another site. Regardless the series gives you what you want action and entertaining characters throughout the series,  the animation and soundtrack fit very nicely together and the voice cast for the subbed and dubbed did a terrific job in their character roles.  The story overall is a little generic no greatly but if you've seen series again like Noir or Phantom:Requiem For The Phantom then the storyline won't shock or surprise you too much.Regardless a entertaining series awaits you to check it out...
summary: If You're A Fan Of Series Like Noir Or GunSlinger Girl Here's One To Check Out Too
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm not going to go into the plot of Canaan, other sites and reviewers have that covered, but here is the deal, Sentai Filmworks has yet again releases another upscaled piece of garbage.Despite the box being labeled progressive (1080p), this entire realease is in fact interlaced. So that is 1080i, which basically translates into "this is a poor quality upscale." For those who don't know what upscaling is, it is basically resizing video or images to a larger size than the original source. This greatly distorts the video and leads to lines that are blurred, artifacting (large squares of ugliness), slow or choppy playback, and all around "eye cancer." It quite literally the DVD video pit on a Blu-ray disc.If want to buy this, get DVDs they are the best quality available. If you want a HD version of this anime you will need to wait, both Sentai and the original studio don't understand how to make HD content. I ended up returning this because I am not going to pay for this horrible mess of a release.I added a screenshot to the images section to show how bad this release is. Make sure to look at it full size, as it naturally looks better at a smaller size. Also the screenshot was not altered in any way from the Blu-ray source.
Title: N/A
